Name: SSL - Write Certificate Pem and Key to the Filesystem
Description: Export the PEM and Key from an SSL certificate to the File System. This is useful in Linux for securing websites or Docker containers

Properties.Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody:
$CertName = $OctopusParameters["SSLCert.Name"] 
Write-Host "Writing PEM and Key files for $Certname"

New-Item -ItemType directory $sslExportPath -Force -Verbose

"Certificate Pem:"
$pemPath = join-path $sslExportPath $sslPemFile
$OctopusParameters["SSLCert.CertificatePem"] | out-file $pemPath -Force -Verbose

"-" * 30

"Certificate Key: "
$keypath = join-path $sslExportPath $sslKeyFile
$OctopusParameters["SSLCert.PrivateKeyPem"] | out-file $keyPath -Force -Verbose

Parameters.Name: sslExportPath
Parameters.Label: Root SSL Epxort Path
Parameters.HelpText: The base directory the key and pem file will be saved to

Parameters.Name: sslPemFile
Parameters.Label: PEM File Name
Parameters.HelpText: The filename to write the PEM to

Parameters.Name: sslKeyFile
Parameters.Label: Key File Name
Parameters.HelpText: The filename to write the Key to
